author: jon kaufthal
text: after all these years, i can finally face my computer. you see, until now, thanks to a not-quite-deep-enough desk, i've had to keep my keyboard in front of me while my monitor sat off to the side - ensuring that, if nothing else, my neck got a healthy workout. now, i'm looking straight on into a strikingly sharp screen. suddenly, the sun is shining, birds are singing, children are playing. and my desk is still only 2 feet deep.the reason for my change in position? compaq's fp500. while it's not radically different from other monitors on the market, the fp500 is the first flat screen considered a checklist item on a new pc. the fp500 looks great - and the picture quality ain't too shabby, either. the monitor's 14.1 viewable inches make it noticeably larger than most "15 inch" monitors, and running 1,024-by-768 resolution is a pleasure. while other flat screens connect through the standard analog vga port (necessitating an expensive and quality-degrading conversion back to a digital signal), the fp500 uses a digital panellink port so its signal is never converted to analog. besides lowering costs, this is one reason it is so eye-catching.so if you can splurge today, the fp500 is a great choice. but if you've got more self-control than i do, don't worry: this is just the beginning of a trend that will make both your real-world and onscreen desktops look a whole lot better.presario fp500 monitor: $899. compaq: (800) 888 0220, street credeasy (web) accessthe robotmakerthe many faces of disgustnew media, old theoriesit's a droid's worldthin is inthe truth is out therememorabilia lanemusiccrowd controlprometheus hardboundcome on feel the noiseone visionary dayreadmestate of fluxmeat spacecontributors
